meta.summary: Dr. Samuel Maina Karumba is a data security and privacy researcher specializing in privacy-preserving architectures, cryptographic frameworks, and secure data governance in AI and blockchain systems. He integrates research with real-world deployment across energy, carbon markets, education, and agriculture, applying cutting-edge cryptography and AI security in decentralized infrastructures.
meta.career_philosophy: Embed trust into the foundation of digital ecosystems. Architect privacy as a right, not a feature.
market_positioning: Postdoctoral Researcher at CSIRO and UNSW

thesis.title: Blockchain-based Decentralized Energy Systems: Advancing Scalability, Security, Privacy, and Interoperability
thesis.author: Karumba, Samuel
thesis.abstract: This thesis introduces a set of blockchain-based frameworks—HARB, PlexiChain, CypherChain, and BAILIF—designed to address the challenges of scalability, cybersecurity, privacy, and interoperability in Decentralized Energy Systems (DES). Each solution utilizes advanced cryptographic, AI, and distributed computing principles, including hypergraph theory, secure multiparty computation, and physical unclonable functions to secure and decentralize smart grid infrastructures.

notable_contributions: Developed 4 blockchain frameworks adopted for energy security use cases
Published 7 research papers linked to thesis chapters
Influenced energy governance standards in Australia and globally

projects.name: HARB
projects.type: Scalability Framework – Hypergraph-Based Adaptive Consortium Blockchain
projects.objective: To address the scalability limitations of decentralized energy systems through a hypergraph-based adaptive consortium blockchain model.
projects.description: HARB (Hypergraph-based Adaptive consoRtium Blockchain) is a blockchain architecture designed to balance decentralization and scalability. It partitions the network using hypergraph theory and adaptive clustering to form region-specific subchains, optimizing consensus performance and transaction throughput in energy systems.
design_features: Dynamic node grouping by energy region
outcomes: Published in IEEE Internet of Things Journal
Outperformed single-chain and PoA models in simulation
Formed the architectural foundation for PlexiChain

projects.name: PlexiChain
projects.type: Secure Blockchain Framework for Flexibility Trading
projects.objective: To counter advanced cybersecurity threats in decentralized energy systems by integrating physical-layer hardware trust with tokenized governance.
projects.description: PlexiChain is a secure blockchain-based flexibility trading framework that integrates Physical Unclonable Functions (PUFs) and Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) to strengthen device identity, ensure data authenticity, and protect decentralized Internet of Things (IoT) nodes. It mitigates attacks such as False Data Injection (FDI) and MadIoT through multi-layered anomaly detection and hardware-anchored cryptographic integrity.

projects.name: BAILIF
projects.objective: To enable secure, atomic, policy-aware interoperability between heterogeneous blockchain networks in decentralized energy systems.
projects.description: BAILIF (Blockchain-Agnostic Interoperability Framework) is designed to overcome interoperability barriers by supporting atomic swaps, cross-chain data exchange, and identity resolution across blockchains. It leverages oracles, notary nodes, and digital identity anchors to maintain system integrity while allowing multiple chains to interoperate without consensus synchronization.
outcomes: Demonstrated secure cross-chain asset swaps in energy token simulation
Published and presented at IEEE ICBC 2023
Cited in energy interoperability whitepapers

projects.name: CypherChain
projects.objective: To ensure privacy-preserving data aggregation and secure computation in decentralized energy markets through blockchain-integrated cryptographic techniques.

It maintains transactional transparency while preserving the anonymity and confidentiality of energy agent offers.
